channel.title: Java CHAT using RSPS files?
channel.description: Would it be possible to eliminate the RS out of RSPS? for inctance i want to use server files of an rsps to make a chat, i was wondering if i could take the chat area at the bottom and make it bigger, also i was wondering if i could eliminate everything else besides the Friends, Ignores, and Group chat

item.title: Java CHAT using RSPS files?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Again. A RSPS uses way more files than a chat needs to work, you’re looking at 50+ in a server of a rsps, while you can have a plain chat using maybe 10 files (I’m sure it can be done in 1… but you shouldn’t do it that way.). And the client (where you would actually see the messages and such) would need 1 for the GUI, which could also handle the task of updating the chat, and setting the connection to the server. And then another to actually send and receive said messages, and a few more to handle the connections and such. It’s way simpler than a RSPS.

+1 to your list of retarded posts

Read full topic

item.title: Java CHAT using RSPS files?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

its stupid but possible

[/quote]

why ridicule? why is it stupid?[/quote]
Again. A RSPS uses way more files than a chat needs to work, you’re looking at 50+ in a server of a rsps, while you can have a plain chat using maybe 10 files (I’m sure it can be done in 1… but you shouldn’t do it that way.). And the client (where you would actually see the messages and such) would need 1 for the GUI, which could also handle the task of updating the chat, and setting the connection to the server. And then another to actually send and receive said messages, and a few more to handle the connections and such. It’s way simpler than a RSPS.
